hints.content:
[[☃ image 1]]



I used $9$ sheets of toilet paper each day for $7$ days.

We can multiply to find the number of sheets used.
 
I have used $7\times9=\blueD{63}$ sheets.

options.alt: A rectangle divided into two unequal parts. The first part is bigger than the second part. The first part is labeled 63 and Used and has a curved bracket across the bottom labeled 7 times 9. The second part is labeled Unused and has a curved bracket across the bottom labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket below the entire rectangle is labeled 96. !

hints.content:
$\greenD{\text{Total}}$ sheets of paper $-$ sheets of paper $\blueD{\text{used}}$ $=$ number of sheets left on the $\maroonD{\text{roll}}$ 



$\greenD{96}-\blueD{63}=\maroonD{33}$

question.content:
I used $9$ sheets of toilet paper each day for $7$ days. The roll had $96$ sheets when it was new. 
 
**How many sheets of toilet paper  have not been used?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] sheets
